Topic.Title: Bac is like a coiled up spring ready to pop

Message.Msg: After Hours Volume: After Hours High: After Hours Low: 1,675,572 $ 12.1344 (16:03:05 PM) $ 12.05 (19:56:47 PM)

Message.Title: My analysis for BAC and housing market and economy in general. Just my honest opinion for discussion.
Message.Msg: Housing market definitely s coming back strong with very little inventory for buyers as many sellers are holding back to sell later for higher prices. Second thing is oil prices will fall by next year and could be lower by as much as 35%. Europe by next year should see better results also. When you add all these things together, you get BAC stock to go back up big time. For example, the house BAC is holding is worth more money also. Interest rates also might start slowly going back up somewhat so the spread can help the banks make even more money. I think this is the perfect condition for much better earnings and for stock appreciation. $40 to $50 is possible by the next year or two I believe. What you guys think?

Message.Title: Disappointing stress test for BAC investors
Message.Msg: BAC holders were expecting a nice distribution in the form of a dividend increase and a large stock buyback program. However, at 6.8% the degree of either distribution will be significantly less. Was hoping to see a ratio number in the high 7% range. Sorry guys.

Topic.Title: Disappointing stress test for BAC investors

Topic.Title: Disappointing stress test for BAC investors

Message.Msg: I like BAC, but I like it less now because there is no way that dividend will become more attractive. Unless the FED chooses to be a little less strict on capital ratios, I think you could have a disappointing week with most financials in their return to shareholder movements. The stock moved alot this week, not sure why everyone doesn't think all the news is priced in already?

Topic.Title: BAC headed to $25 next year - fundamentals looking good

Message.Msg: I guess technical profit taking because at the open it set a new 12-month high and when BAC didn't make any statement after FED release of data on capital (C did comment with a positive spin that they will do $1.2 bi buyback) that could have been a disappointment. FED advised banks to not pre-maturely make statement about capital giveback until this coming Thu but C jumped the guns (what if FED reject their plan like last time?). If BAC pays more attention to their cost structure, BAC will recover fast. My acquaintance whose friend works for BAC was saying that friend has very little to do - just show up for work and that's very common throughout the bank per this employee and I believe that to be true and that's why in JPM's Dimon slide BAC cost-structure was the worst (C's was not good either). For whatever reason, Moynihan has not been very aggressive on staffing issues throughout the bank - yes he cut 30,000 in investment banking and trading desks (because of Volcker rule) but BAC is very inefficient and needs to reduce staff more throughout the bank. Bove says BAC has the potential to earn $2.75 per share and stock could be at $30 if they pay more attention to their cost-structure.

Topic.Title: Disappointing stress test for BAC investors

Message.Msg: I'm anticipating a raise to .04 cents for the dividend and a 4 billion dollar buyback...They have a cushion of billions + this years earnings. With the housing market improving, I think the fed will be more apt to give the banks some rope.

Topic.Title: BAC headed to $25 next year - fundamentals looking good

Message.Msg: BAC CEO Brian is appearing to be one of the best. He has his hands tied dealing with the legacy issues, especially settlements. $15-$18 by this year end.
